Content_FullWidth.Name: Professional Development Conference
Content_FullWidth.Title: Professional Development Conference 2011
Content_FullWidth.Abstract: Managers and owners: register now for the 2011 Professional Development Conference: August 31, 2011.
Content_FullWidth.BodyCopy:
Professional Development Conference August 31, 2011

We’re excited to announce this year’s theme for the Professional Development Conference: “Prepare Every Needful Thing (D&C 88:117-119).” The focus of our time together will center on learning, organizing, and establishing patterns of Zion that point to lasting success as managers and owners while helping students have a meaningful and rewarding experience.

See below for additional details:

OWNER RECEPTION
All complex owners are invited to attend the Owner Reception. This is an opportunity for owners to mix, mingle, and network. This will be hosted in the Manwaring Center Special Events Room 387 Tuesday August 30, 2011 from 6:30-8:30 p.m.


Refreshments will be provided.

REGISTRATION
New Managers: Begins @ 7:45 a.m. (Wednesday August 31, 2011)

All Other Attendees: Begins @ 8:00-8:45 a.m. (Wednesday August 31, 2011)

PRE-CONFERENCE SESSIONS

New Managers All new managers are invited to participate in a Pre-Conference Training session that will begin at 8:00 a.m. Wednesday August 31 in Taylor 180.

WeCar This presentation will be given by representives from WeCar to introduce the new car sharing program beginning on campus this fall. This will be an excellent session for owners who experience parking shrotages. It will be held at 8:00 a.m. in Taylor 120. 

CONFERENCE SESSIONS

There will be four, 45-minute workshops leading up to lunch. Attendees are welcome to choose which classes they would like to attend. Many will be offered multiple times to allow attendees to participate in as many sessions as possible.

The schedule of classes will be posted and shared with attendees in the coming weeks.

LUNCH
When:  1:00-2:00 p.m.

Where: Thomas E. Ricks Garden Pavilion (weather permitting)

For catering purposes, please register for a meal ticket if you are planning on attending. If circumstances prevent attendance, please let us know by registering for the Conference Ticket.

POST-CONFERENCE SESSION (Optional)
A general Q&A session will begin at 2:30 p.m. in Taylor 120. All owners and managers are invited to attend.

If you have any questions, please contact Sherstin Law at laws@byui.edu.
